home.preinst:
We're happy to have you join us in this exciting learning adventure!

Here's what you'll do during the program:

  1. 1. Log in to the portal to get started.
  2. 2. Complete the pre-survey to share your thoughts before we begin.
  3. 3. Dive into the course and explore all the amazing videos.
  4. 4. Work with your teammates to identify a problem and work together to find a solution.
  5. 5. Submit your innovative idea to the Innovation Marathon and showcase your creativity.
  6. 6. Complete the post-survey to share your feedback and experience.
  7. 7. Download your certificates to celebrate your achievements!

    8. We can't wait to see the incredible ideas you'll come up with. Have fun, learn a lot, and let's make this an unforgettable journey!

get_started.heading: Welcome Students!
get_started.desc:
We are glad that you have signed-up to this program and joined us in this exciting journey of nurturing an experience of learning, skilling and innovation for the young people. As you are aware you will be playing a role of student for the participants in their learning journey.

This portal gives you an experience of learning modules and important resources for supporting the participants. You can also register and track progress of your teams using the dashboard.

Your journey as a teacher/mentor will involve the following key milestones:

  • Step-1: Take Pre-Survey
  • Step-2: Complete the course and reading material
  • Step-3: Register the teams
  • Step-4: Support the participants in completing the learning journey.
  • Step-5: Support the participants in challenge/idea submission.
  • Step-6: Complete the post survey.

We hope you and your teams will have a great learning experience and wish you all the best for this program!

teacher_get_started.heading: Welcome Guide Teacher!
teacher_get_started.desc:
We are delighted that you have signed up for this program and have joined us on this journey of nurturing problem solving and innovation in youth. As you are already aware, you will be playing the role of a guide teacher to the students for the duration of the course.

The portal includes various information modules and resources that will help you and your students on their learning journeys.

Your journey as a guide teacher will include the following key milestones

  1. Register yourself on the portal and take the pre-survey.
  2. Understand the program and the tech platform.
  3. Identify teams and register them on the portal.
  4. Arrange access to digital devices for students.
  5. Support the students on their learning journey.
  6. Ensure teams submit their final ideas on the portal.
  7. Complete the post survey.
  8. Download teacher‚Äôs certificate.
  9. Instruct and support the students to download student certificates.

We hope you and the students have a great time doing this program.

We wish you all the best!

student_get_started.heading: Welcome Students!
student_get_started.desc:
We are glad that you are part of this program and have joined us in this exciting journey of learning, skilling and innovation. There are many exciting things awaiting you in this journey.

You will learn through this platform, work with your team and be supported by your teachers as well.

Your journey as a participant will involve the following key steps:

  • Step 1: Take Pre-Survey

  • Step 2: Start the course by watching the video.

  • Step 3: Complete each module and attempt the Quiz.

  • Step 4: Work with your team on the worksheets in each module to complete your own problem solving journey.

  • Step 5: Submit your team‚Äôs final idea.

  • Step 6: Complete the post survey.

We hope you and your teams will have a great learning experience and wish you all the best for this program!

student.worksheet:
Dear Student,

The workbook is a set of activity sheets that will help you do the course, understand and practice your problem solving journey better. They are based on the concepts you learnt in the videos and are expected to do it as a team. Every team will have a workbook.

Step-1: While it is good to have a printed workbook, it is not compulsory to take a print out. In case you do not have a printed workbook, you can refer to the workbook on a digital device and write down the page number and question number and then answer the questions in notebooks / papers.

Step-2:After watching the videos, discuss the concepts you learnt and the related module workbook pages with your team before you start to do the workbook. (Remember that Workbook is a Team Activity, not individual task)

Hope you and your team learn new things and enjoy completing this workbook.

Themes & Focus Areas


Go through themes and problems statements document and choose one problem among all. Keep working on the chosen problem using the problem solving the techniques you learn as part of this course to submit your idea for it during idea submission process.

student_course.cong_msg_menu:
üéâ Congratulations on completing the course! üéâ

You did it! Your dedication and hard work have brought you to this exciting milestone. We are incredibly proud of your achievement and the effort you've put into the program.

This accomplishment marks just the beginning of your journey. The knowledge you've gained will be a valuable asset as you move forward in the program. Remember, learning is a lifelong adventure, and you've proven your ability to thrive in it.

We can't wait to see all the amazing Ideas you & your team are going to submit.
student_course.quiz_inst_msg1: Now that you have watched some videos, learnt new concepts, discussed them with your team and teacher and practiced them using the workbook, it's time to check how much you have understood.
student_course.quiz_inst_msg2:
INSTRUCTIONS:
  1. Read and understand the question carefully before answering.
  2. Quiz will consist of 10-15 questions and will take 5-10 minutes to complete.
  3. Score will be displayed at the end of the quiz for your reference.
  4. You need to get at least 60% i.e., at least answer 6-8 questions correctly to move to the next module and unlock the videos.
  5. You can retake the quiz again if you score less than 60%.
student_course.idea_ins_note:
As you prepare to submit your idea, follow these important steps to ensure a successful submission:

Step-1: üìπ Watch the Idea Submission Process video in the Resources section. Discuss with your team members and guide the teacher to finalize your idea.

Step-2:‚úçÔ∏è Write down your idea on paper or in a notebook before entering it on the website.

Step-3: üìù Only the student who initiates the idea can edit and submit it. Coordinate with your team and teacher before starting the submission process.

Step-4: üíæ Use the 'Save as Draft' option regularly to prevent data loss in case of disconnections.

Step-5: üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Fill out the form carefully. Double-check all entries before saving or submitting. Ask your guide teacher to review the details to ensure accuracy.

Note: üö´ Once submitted, you cannot make changes. Invalid or incorrect entries will not be considered.

Details to Prepare Before Submitting Your Idea:


  • 1. Review Themes & Focus Areas: üìö Carefully examine the Themes document to identify the one that best aligns with your concept.
  • 2. Select Your Theme and Focus Area: üéØ Choose the theme and focus area that are most pertinent to your project.
  • 3. Craft Your Idea Title and Description: ‚úçÔ∏è Formulate a precise and compelling title along with detailed description that highlights uniqueness of your Idea.
  • 4. Document Technologies and Concepts Utilized: üõ†Ô∏è List the technologies or concepts used in your project and explain how they were applied.
  • 5. Assemble Supporting Materials: üìÑ Ensure your Project Research Document is complete, and gather any relevant images, videos of your prototype or design, and presentations, especially if you've completed the Make & Test phase.

If you've completed all the steps above, go ahead and submit your ideas to make an impact!

ideaform_questions.focusareaq: Select Focus Area of your Idea
ideaform_questions.ideatitleq: Title of your idea (Think of a proper name. Don't describe the solution or problem statement here.)
ideaform_questions.causesq: List the Causes of the problem.
ideaform_questions.effectsq: List the Effects of the problem
ideaform_questions.communityq: In which places in your community did you find this problem?
ideaform_questions.communityop3: Other places in the surroundings (Market/Park/Playground etc.)
ideaform_questions.communityop4: Others (Read in newspapers, saw on the internet, etc.)
ideaform_questions.facingq: Who all are facing this problem?
ideaform_questions.solutiondetailsq: Describe the solution to the problem your team found. Explain your solution clearly - how does it work, who is it helping, and how will it solve the problem.
ideaform_questions.stakeholdersq: Apart from your teacher, how many people/stakeholders did you speak to to understand or improve your problem or solution?
ideaform_questions.probsoljourneyq: Pick the actions your team did in your problem solving journey (You can choose multiple options)
ideaform_questions.probsoljourneyop1: We did the full problem solving journey by ourselves.
ideaform_questions.probsoljourneyop2: We got feedback on our problem and modified it
ideaform_questions.probsoljourneyop3: We got feedback on our idea and modified it
ideaform_questions.probsoljourneyop4: We got feedback on our prototype and modified it
ideaform_questions.feedbackq: Mention the feedback that your team got and the changes you have made, if any, to your problem or solution.
ideaform_questions.uploadq: Upload images/documents & video links of your prototype.  (total size limit : 10mb)
ideaform_questions.workbookq: Did your team complete and submit the workbook to your school Guide teacher?
ideaform_questions.ideawarning: Save your idea & Ask your guide teacher to go through the details entered by you to make sure they are correct. You cannot make changes once the idea is submitted. Invalid/Wrong entries will not be selected.
ideaform_questions.placeholdertext: List one by one with numbering‚Ä¶

themedetails.sustainabletheme: Sustainable Development is about balancing economic growth, environmental care, and social well-being to ensure a better future for all.
themedetails.digitaltheme: Highlights the critical role of digital technologies in bridging the digital divide and fostering innovation, making India a leader in the digital economy.
themedetails.healththeme: Focuses on ensuring physical, mental, and social wellness for individuals and communities to lead fulfilling lives.
themedetails.educationtheme: Quality Education ensures inclusive, equitable learning opportunities that empower individuals with the knowledge and skills needed for lifelong success.
themedetails.economictheme: Economic Empowerment enables individuals and communities to improve their financial stability and independence through access to resources, opportunities, and skills.
themedetails.smarttheme: Smart and Resilient Communities use technology and sustainable practices to adapt to challenges, ensuring safety, efficiency, and long-term well-being for all members.
themedetails.agritheme: Focuses on improving farming practices and infrastructure in rural areas to boost productivity, sustainability, and quality of life for rural communities.
themedetails.othertheme: Encourages innovative solutions in any other area that aligns with the vision of Viksit Bharat 2047, fostering a culture of broad-based development and progress.

sustainablefocusareas.focusarea3: Clean Water (e.g., water purification, rainwater harvesting)
sustainablefocusareas.focusarea5: Sustainable Agriculture (e.g., organic farming, soil conservation)

digitalfocusareas.focusarea1: Internet of Things (IoT) (e.g., smart homes, connected devices)
digitalfocusareas.focusarea3: Cybersecurity (e.g., protecting data, secure online practices)
digitalfocusareas.focusarea5: Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Machine Learning (ML) (e.g., smart assistants, predictive analytics)

healthfocusareas.focusarea1: Medical Devices (e.g., health monitors, diagnostic tools)
healthfocusareas.focusarea2: Nutrition and Healthy Eating (e.g., balanced diets, fortified foods)
healthfocusareas.focusarea3: Mental Health (e.g., stress management, counseling tools)
healthfocusareas.focusarea4: Fitness and Sports (e.g., exercise programs, sports innovations)

educationfocusareas.focusarea1: Online Learning (e.g., e-learning platforms, virtual classrooms)
educationfocusareas.focusarea2: Inclusive Education (e.g., education for all, special needs education)
educationfocusareas.focusarea3: Teacher Training (e.g., professional development, new teaching methods)
educationfocusareas.focusarea4: Educational Technology (e.g., interactive learning tools, digital textbooks)

economicfocusareas.focusarea2: Start-up Innovations (e.g., new business ideas, entrepreneurship support)
economicfocusareas.focusarea3: Vocational Training (e.g., skill development, job readiness)
economicfocusareas.focusarea4: Retail Innovations (e.g., new products, better shopping experiences)

smartfocusareas.focusarea1: Smart Cities (e.g., smart traffic systems, digital public services)
smartfocusareas.focusarea2: Electric Vehicles (e.g., electric cars, charging stations)
smartfocusareas.focusarea3: Disaster Management (e.g., emergency response systems, disaster-proof buildings)
smartfocusareas.focusarea4: Robotics and Drones (e.g., automation, aerial surveys)
smartfocusareas.focusarea5: Smart Textiles (e.g., wearable technology, smart fabrics)
smartfocusareas.focusarea6: Travel and Tourism (e.g., eco-tourism, smart travel apps)

agrifocusareas.focusarea1: Modern Farming Techniques (e.g., hydroponics, precision farming)
agrifocusareas.focusarea2: Rural Development (e.g., rural infrastructure, community projects)
agrifocusareas.focusarea3: Food Security (e.g., food storage, distribution systems)

otherfocusareas.focusarea1: Any other area that broadly qualifies for the vision of Viksit Bharat
